column1: # Monthly readings started in October 1820 - the annual total for 1820 is an estimate and has been omitted.
# January-February 1850 are grouped into a single aggregate estimated reading on the sheet, which has been omitted.
# Readings for 1854 are crossed out on the sheet and re-entered for 1855. No readings have been retained for 1854.
# The February 1855 reading is shown as an estimate due to the gauge bursting, and has been retained.
# Comments indicate that the gauge also burst in March 1837, December 1841 and January 1842, although they are not marked as estimates. Values for these months have been retained.
# February-March 1860 are grouped into a single aggregate reading of 3.20 on the sheet.
# Readings for 1895 on the rainfall sheet are marked as 'Utterly unreliable'. The extremely low annual total and several zero-reading months support this. The readings have been omitted.
